name: Virginia Apgar
quote: Nobody, but nobody, is going to stop breathing on me.
summary: American physician who developed the Apgar Score, a standardized method to assess the health of newborn babies immediately after birth.
shortDescription: Virginia Apgar was an American physician who developed the Apgar Score, a standardized method to assess the health of newborn babies. Her simple scoring system has saved countless lives and is used worldwide.

detailed_description.early_life: Born in Westfield, New Jersey, Virginia showed early interest in science and medicine. She earned her medical degree from Columbia University.
detailed_description.stem_journey: Virginia specialized in anesthesiology and became interested in newborn care. She developed the Apgar Score to quickly assess newborn health.
detailed_description.challenges: As a woman in medicine, Virginia faced gender discrimination. She also had to prove the value of her simple scoring system.
detailed_description.achievements: Developed the Apgar Score, became the first woman full professor at Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons.
detailed_description.legacy: Virginia's Apgar Score has saved countless newborn lives and is used worldwide in every delivery room.

achievements: First woman full professor at Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons
awards: Distinguished Service Award from American Society of Anesthesiologists

publications.title: A Proposal for a New Method of Evaluation of the Newborn Infant

impact: Saved countless newborn lives and revolutionized newborn care worldwide.

media.title: Virginia Apgar: Pioneer in Newborn Care

mentorship: Mentored students and advocated for women in medicine.
fun_fact: The Apgar Score is named after Virginia Apgar and also stands for Appearance, Pulse, Grimace, Activity, and Respiration.

career_path.advice_for_students: Simple solutions can save lives. Don't underestimate the power of observation.
